payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` â€“ FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` â€“ Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` â€“ Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` â€“ Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` â€“ Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` â€“ Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` â€“ Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` â€“ Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` â€“ Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` â€“ End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` â€“ Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.

<user_instructions>

# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` â€“ FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` â€“ Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` â€“ Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` â€“ Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` â€“ Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` â€“ Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` â€“ Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` â€“ Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` â€“ Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` â€“ End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` â€“ Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.


</user_instructions>

Operate autonomously as the WeatherVane super-team. Your goal is to drive the roadmap to completion with world-class engineering, data/ML, product, and design rigor.

Current surprise QA ledger:
- No surprise QA audits recorded yet.

Loop:
1. Read state/roadmap.yaml and choose the highest-priority task(s) not done.
2. Call  to refresh the audit ledger for this session.
3. Run  as a lightweight heartbeat; checkpoint if resource limits appear tight.
4. For each chosen task:
   a. Audit docs/code/tests/design to understand requirements.
   b. Implement the work via fs_read/fs_write/cmd_run (code + tests + docs + design polish). Keep slices small enough to verify quickly.
   c. Run critics_run with ["build","tests","manager_self_check","data_quality","design_system","org_pm","exec_review","health_check","human_sync"] and add allocator/causal/forecast critics when relevant. Use state/critics timestamps/results (including git_sha metadata) to skip suites that have already covered unchanged artifacts this session; rerun when the commit changes or after meaningful edits.
   d. Fix issues. If blocked, log the blocker clearly and mark the task blocked with plan_update.
   e. Record decisions, risks, and next actions via context_write (keep state/context.md <= 1000 words).
   f. Snapshot via context_snapshot.
   g. Update roadmap status with plan_update only after exit criteria are satisfied.
   h. For work expected to run longer than ~5 minutes, queue it with heavy_queue_enqueue (include command/context), monitor via heavy_queue_list, and update status with heavy_queue_update while continuing other work.
5. Prioritise shipping real work over repeated self-review loops while still running critics after meaningful changes land; if nothing changed, move forward instead of re-running the same suites.
6. Approximately once every 100 tasks/messages, deliberately audit a completed roadmap item for hidden gaps or regressions. After each surprise QA, call autopilot_record_audit with task_id/focus/notes and, if issues emerge, open fresh tasks to land fixes before resuming new work.
7. Spread surprise QA audits across different epics/milestones rather than clustering; skip the audit if you already inspected that item in the current session.
8. Repeat on remaining tasks. Stop only when no further progress is possible without human intervention.
Maintain production readiness, enforce ML/causal rigor, polish UX, and communicate like a Staff+/startup leader.
Return JSON summarizing completed tasks, tasks still in progress, blockers, next focus items, and overall notes.

tenant_id\n        self.start = start\n        self.end = end\n        self.leakage_rows = leakage_rows\n        self.leakage_dates = leakage_dates\n        self.forward_rows = forward_rows\n        self.forward_dates = forward_dates\n        self.forecast_rows = forecast_rows\n        self.forecast_dates = forecast_dates\n        self.matrix = matrix\n        summary = (\n            f\"Potential leakage detected for tenant={tenant_id} \"\n            f\"window=[{start.date().isoformat()}, {end.date().isoformat()}]: \"\n            f\"total_rows={leakage_rows}, forward_rows={forward_rows}, forecast_rows={forecast_rows}, \"\n            f\"dates={leakage_dates}\"\n        )\n        super().__init__(summary)\n\n    def as_dict(self) -> Dict[str, List[str] | int | str]:\n        return {\n            \"tenant_id\": self.tenant_id,\n            \"start\": self.start.isoformat(),\n            \"end\": self.end.isoformat(),\n            \"leakage_rows\": self.leakage_rows,\n            \"leakage_dates\": list(self.leakage_dates),\n            \"forward_leakage_rows\": self.forward_rows,\n            \"forward_leakage_dates\": list(self.forward_dates),\n            \"forecast_leakage_rows\": self.forecast_rows,\n            \"forecast_leakage_dates\": list(self.forecast_dates),\n            \"sanitized_rows\": self.matrix.frame.height if self.matrix else None,\n        }\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass FeatureMatrix:\n    frame: pl.DataFrame\n    observed_frame: pl.DataFrame\n    orders_rows: int\n    ads_rows: int\n    promo_rows: int\n    weather_rows: int\n    observed_rows: int\n    latest_observed_date: str | None\n    profiles: Dict[str, DatasetProfile]\n    leakage_risk_rows: int\n    leakage_risk_dates: List[str]\n    forward_leakage_rows: int\n    forward_leakage_dates: List[str]\n    forecast_leakage_rows: int\n    forecast_leakage_dates: List[str]\n\n\nclass FeatureBuilder:\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        lake_root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/lake/raw\"),\n        feature_seed: int = 2024,\n        feature_min_rows: int = 14,\n    ) -> None:\n        self.writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n        self.feature_min_rows = max(feature_min_rows, 1)\n        self.feature_generator = LagRollingFeatureGenerator(\n            LagRollingFeatureGenerator.default_specs(),\n            date_col=\"date\",\n            group_cols=[\"geohash\"],\n            seed=feature_seed,\n        )\n\n    def build(self, tenant_id: str, start: datetime, end: datetime) -> FeatureMatrix:\n        orders = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_shopify_orders\")\n        ads_meta = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_meta_ads\")\n        ads_google = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_google_ads\")\n        promos = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_promos\")\n        weather = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_weather_daily\")\n\n        orders_daily = self._orders_daily(orders)\n        ads_daily = self._ads_daily(ads_meta, ads_google)\n        promos_daily = self._promos_daily(promos)\n        weather_daily = self._weather_daily(weather)\n\n        join_on_geo = (\n            \"geohash\" in orders_daily.columns\n            and \"geohash\" in weather_daily.columns\n            and not orders_daily.get_column(\"geohash\").is_null().all()\n            and not weather_daily.get_column(\"geohash\").is_null().all()\n        )\n\n        if not orders_daily.is_empty():\n            if join_on_geo:\n                frame = orders_daily.join(weather_daily, on=[\"date\", \"geohash\"], how=\"left\")\n            else:\n                frame = orders_daily.join(weather_daily, on=[\"date\"], how=\"left\")\n        else:\n            frame = weather_daily\n\n        if TARGET_COLUMN not in frame.columns:\n            frame = frame.with_columns(pl.lit(None, dtype=pl.Float64).alias(TARGET_COLUMN))\n\n        frame = frame.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").cast(pl.Utf8))\n\n        ads_join = ads_daily.drop([col for col in [\"geohash\"] if col in ads_daily.columns])\n        promos_join = promos_daily.drop([col for col in [\"geohash\"] if col in promos_daily.columns])\n\n        frame = frame.join(ads_join, on=\"date\", how=\"full\", suffix=\"_ads\")\n        if \"date_ads\" in frame.columns:\n            frame = (\n                frame.with_columns(\n                    pl.when(pl.col(\"date\").is_null())\n                    .then(pl.col(\"date_ads\"))\n                    .otherwise(pl.col(\"date\"))\n                    .alias(\"date\")\n                )\n                .drop(\"date_ads\")\n            )\n        frame = frame.join(promos_join, on=\"date\", how=\"full\", suffix=\"_promo\")\n        if \"date_promo\" in frame.columns:\n            frame = (\n                frame.with_columns(\n                    pl.when(pl.col(\"date\").is_null())\n                    .then(pl.col(\"date_promo\"))\n                    .otherwise(pl.col(\"date\"))\n                    .alias(\"date\")\n                )\n                .drop(\"date_promo\")\n            )\n        frame = frame.sort(\"date\")\n        start_str = start.date().isoformat()\n        end_str = end.date().isoformat()\n        frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"date\").is_between(pl.lit(start_str), pl.lit(end_str)))\n\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            pl.col(TARGET_COLUMN).is_not_null().alias(\"target_available\"),\n        )\n\n        if frame.width > 0:\n            frame = frame.with_columns(cs.numeric().fill_null(0))\n\n        forward_looking_columns = [\n            column\n            for column in frame.columns\n            if column.endswith(\"_spend\")\n            or column.endswith(\"_conversions\")\n            or column == \"promos_sent\"\n        ]\n        forward_signal_expr = (\n            pl.lit(False)\n            if not forward_looking_columns\n            else pl.any_horizontal(\n                [\n                    pl.col(column).cast(pl.Float64).fill_null(0.0).abs() > 0.0\n                    for column in forward_looking_columns\n                ]\n            )\n        )\n        forward_leakage_expr = (~pl.col(\"target_available\")) & forward_signal_expr\n        forecast_leakage_expr = (\n            pl.col(\"observation_type\")\n            .cast(pl.Utf8)\n            .str.to_lowercase()\n            .eq(\"forecast\")\n            & pl.col(\"target_available\")\n            if \"observation_type\" in frame.columns\n            else pl.lit(False)\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            [\n                forward_leakage_expr.alias(\"_forward_leakage\"),\n                forecast_leakage_expr.alias(\"_forecast_leakage\"),\n            ]\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            (pl.col(\"_forward_leakage\") | pl.col(\"_forecast_leakage\")).alias(\"leakage_risk\")\n        )\n\n        forward_leakage_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"_forward_leakage\"))\n        forward_leakage_rows = int(forward_leakage_frame.height)\n        forward_leakage_dates = (\n            forward_leakage_frame.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if forward_leakage_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        forecast_leakage_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"_forecast_leakage\"))\n        forecast_leakage_rows = int(forecast_leakage_frame.height)\n        forecast_leakage_dates = (\n            forecast_leakage_frame.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if forecast_leakage_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        frame = frame.drop([\"_forward_leakage\", \"_forecast_leakage\"])\n\n        missing = [col for col in REQUIRED_WEATHER_COLS if col not in frame.columns]\n        if missing:\n            raise ValueError(f\"Weather features missing from matrix: {missing}\")\n\n        validate_feature_matrix(frame)\n        profiles: Dict[str, DatasetProfile] = {}\n        try:\n            profiles[\"orders\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"orders\", orders)\n            ads_combined = pl.concat([df for df in (ads_meta, ads_google) if not df.is_empty()], how=\"vertical\") if (not ads_meta.is_empty() or not ads_google.is_empty()) else pl.DataFrame([])\n            profiles[\"ads\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"ads\", ads_combined)\n            profiles[\"promos\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"promos\", promos)\n            profiles[\"weather\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"weather\", weather)\n        except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - profiling is best-effort\n            profiles = {}\n\n        leakage_rows = frame.filter(pl.col(\"leakage_risk\"))\n        leakage_risk_rows = int(leakage_rows.height)\n        leakage_risk_dates = (\n            leakage_rows.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if leakage_risk_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        frame = frame.filter(~pl.col(\"leakage_risk\")) if leakage_risk_rows > 0 else frame\n        if frame.height >= self.feature_min_rows:\n            frame = self.feature_generator.transform(frame)\n        observed_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"target_available\"))\n        observed_rows = int(observed_frame.height)\n        max_observed_date = observed_frame[\"date\"].max() if observed_rows > 0 else None\n        latest_observed_date = str(max_observed_date) if isinstance(max_observed_date, str) else max_observed_date\n        matrix = FeatureMatrix(\n            frame=frame,\n            observed_frame=observed_frame,\n            orders_rows=int(orders.height),\n            ads_rows=int(ads_meta.height + ads_google.height),\n            promo_rows=int(promos.height),\n            weather_rows=int(weather.height),\n            observed_rows=observed_rows,\n            latest_observed_date=latest_observed_date,\n            profiles=profiles,\n            leakage_risk_rows=leakage_risk_rows,\n            leakage_risk_dates=[str(date) for date in leakage_risk_dates],\n            forward_leakage_rows=forward_leakage_rows,\n            forward_leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in forward_leakage_dates],\n            forecast_leakage_rows=forecast_leakage_rows,\n            forecast_leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in forecast_leakage_dates],\n        )\n        if leakage_risk_rows > 0:\n            raise FeatureLeakageError(\n                tenant_id,\n                start,\n                end,\n            leakage_rows=leakage_risk_rows,\n                leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in leakage_risk_dates],\n                forward_rows=forward_leakage_rows,\n                forward_dates=matrix.forward_leakage_dates,\n                forecast_rows=forecast_leakage_rows,\n                forecast_dates=matrix.forecast_leakage_dates,\n                matrix=matrix,\n            )\n        return matrix\n\n    def _load_latest(self, dataset: str) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        path = self.writer.latest(dataset)\n        if not path:\n            return pl.DataFrame([])\n        return read_parquet(path)\n\n    def _orders_daily(self, orders: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if orders.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\"date\": [], \"geohash\": [], \"net_revenue\": []})\n        if \"created_at\" not in orders.columns:\n            raise ValueError(\"orders dataset missing `created_at`\")\n        frame = orders.with_columns([\n            pl.col(\"created_at\").str.slice(0, 10).alias(\"date\"),\n            pl.col(\"ship_geohash\").alias(\"geohash\"),\n        ])\n        group_cols = [\"date\", \"geohash\"] if \"ship_geohash\" in orders.columns else [\"date\"]\n        return frame.group_by(group_cols).agg(pl.col(\"net_revenue\").sum())\n\n    def _ads_daily(self, meta: pl.DataFrame, google: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        frames = []\n        if not meta.is_empty():\n            frames.append(\n                meta.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").alias(\"date\"))\n                .group_by(\"date\")\n                .agg([\n                    pl.col(\"spend\").sum().alias(\"meta_spend\"),\n                    pl.col(\"conversions\").sum().alias(\"meta_conversions\"),\n                ])\n                .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n            )\n        if not google.is_empty():\n            frames.append(\n                google.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").alias(\"date\"))\n                .group_by(\"date\")\n                .agg([\n                    pl.col(\"spend\").sum().alias(\"google_spend\"),\n                    pl.col(\"conversions\").sum().alias(\"google_conversions\"),\n                ])\n                .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n            )\n        if not frames:\n            return pl.DataFrame({\n                \"date\": [],\n                \"geohash\": [],\n                \"meta_spend\": [],\n                \"meta_conversions\": [],\n                \"google_spend\": [],\n                \"google_conversions\": [],\n            })\n        return (\n            pl.concat(frames, how=\"align\")\n            .group_by(\"date\")\n            .agg([\n                pl.col(\"meta_spend\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"meta_conversions\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"google_spend\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"google_conversions\").sum(),\n            ])\n            .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n        )\n\n    def _promos_daily(self, promos: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if promos.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\"date\": [], \"geohash\": [], \"promos_sent\": []})\n        col = \"send_date\" if \"send_date\" in promos.columns else \"scheduled_at\"\n        return (\n            promos\n            .with_columns(pl.col(col).str.slice(0, 10).alias(\"date\"))\n            .group_by(\"date\")\n            .agg(pl.len().alias(\"promos_sent\"))\n            .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n        )\n\n    def _weather_daily(self, weather: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if weather.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\n                \"date\": [],\n                \"geohash\": [],\n                \"temp_c\": [],\n                \"precip_mm\": [],\n                \"temp_anomaly\": [],\n                \"precip_anomaly\": [],\n                \"temp_roll7\": [],\n                \"precip_roll7\": [],\n            })\n        missing = REQUIRED_WEATHER_COLS - set(weather.columns)\n        if missing:\n            raise ValueError(f\"Weather dataset missing columns: {missing}\")\n        frame = weather.with_columns(\n            pl.col(\"date\").str.strptime(pl.Date, strict=False).alias(\"date\"),\n        )\n        frame = frame.sort([\"geohash\", \"date\"])\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            pl.col(\"temp_c\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=3)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"temp_roll7\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_mm\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=3)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"precip_roll7\"),\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").cast(pl.Utf8))\n        return frame\n"
}

{
  "path": "apps/model/pipelines/poc_models.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"High-level modelling pipeline used by the PoC flow.\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom typing import Dict\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom apps.model.baseline import BaselineModel, fit_baseline_model, evaluate_r2\nfrom apps.model.mmm import MMMModel, fit_mmm_model\nfrom apps.model.ts_training import FitResult, fit_timeseries\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass ModelBundle:\n    baseline: BaselineModel\n    mmm: MMMModel\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, float]\n    quantiles: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]\n    timeseries: FitResult | None\n\n\ndef train_poc_models(matrix: Dict[str, list], target: str = \"net_revenue\") -> ModelBundle:\n    frame = pl.DataFrame(matrix)\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        empty_model = BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=0.0, features=[], target=target)\n        return ModelBundle(\n            baseline=empty_model,\n            mmm=MMMModel(base_roas=0.0, elasticity={}, mean_roas={}, mean_spend={}, features=[]),\n            diagnostics={\n                \"row_count\": 0.0,\n                \"feature_columns\": 0.0,\n                \"baseline_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"timeseries_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"average_roas\": 0.0,\n                \"cv_mean\": 0.0,\n                \"holdout_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"mae\": 0.0,\n                \"rmse\": 0.0,\n                \"bias\": 0.0,\n                \"prediction_std\": 0.0,\n                \"quantile_width\": 0.0,\n            },\n            quantiles={\"expected_revenue\": {\"p10\": 1.0, \"p50\": 1.0, \"p90\": 1.0}},\n            timeseries=None,\n        )\n\n    feature_cols = [\n        col\n        for col in frame.columns\n        if col != target and frame[col].dtype in (pl.Float64, pl.Float32, pl.Int64, pl.Int32)\n    ]\n    baseline = fit_baseline_model(frame, target=target, features=feature_cols)\n\n    ts_frame = frame.select([\"date\"] + feature_cols + [target])\n    ts_result = fit_timeseries(ts_frame, \"date\", target, feature_cols)\n    ts_features = frame.select(feature_cols)\n    ts_predictions = ts_result.model.predict(ts_features.to_numpy())\n\n    spend_cols = [col for col in frame.columns if \"spend\" in col]\n    mmm = fit_mmm_model(frame, spend_cols=spend_cols, revenue_col=target)\n\n    actuals = frame[target].to_numpy()\n    residuals = actuals - ts_predictions\n\n    with np.errstate(divide=\"ignore\", invalid=\"ignore\"):\n        prediction_safe = np.where(np.abs(ts_predictions) < 1e-6, 1.0, ts_predictions)\n        ratio_residuals = residuals / prediction_safe\n    distribution = np.clip(1.0 + ratio_residuals, 0.0, None)\n    q10 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.10))\n    q50 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.50))\n    q90 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.90))\n\n    mae = float(np.mean(np.abs(residuals)))\n    rmse = float(np.sqrt(np.mean(residuals ** 2)))\n    bias = float(np.mean(residuals))\n    quantile_width = q90 - q10\n    prediction_std = float(np.std(ts_predictions))\n    timeseries_r2 = float(ts_result.model.score(ts_features.to_numpy(), actuals))\n\n    diagnostics = {\n        \"row_count\": float(frame.height),\n        \"feature_columns\": float(len(feature_cols)),\n        \"baseline_r2\": evaluate_r2(baseline, frame),\n        \"timeseries_r2\": timeseries_r2,\n        \"average_roas\": mmm.base_roas,\n        \"cv_mean\": float(np.mean(ts_result.cv_scores) if ts_result.cv_scores else 0.0),\n        \"holdout_r2\": ts_result.holdout_r2,\n        \"mae\": mae,\n        \"rmse\": rmse,\n        \"bias\": bias,\n        \"prediction_std\": prediction_std,\n        \"quantile_width\": quantile_width,\n    }\n    quantiles = {\"expected_revenue\": {\"p10\": q10, \"p50\": q50, \"p90\": q90}}\n    return ModelBundle(\n        baseline=baseline,\n        mmm=mmm,\n        diagnostics=diagnostics,\n        quantiles=quantiles,\n        timeseries=ts_result,\n    )\n"
}

}

{
  "path": "apps/model/baseline.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Baseline + weather modelling utilities.\n\nWe train a weather-aware Generalised Additive Model (GAM) when pyGAM is available and\nfall back to a deterministic linear regression otherwise. The GAM captures smooth\nnon-linear relationships for weather + marketing signals, along with limited\ninteractions, while respecting small-sample guardrails so that scaffolding tests can\ncontinue to run without the optional dependency.\n\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nimport itertools\nimport subprocess\nimport sys\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom typing import Any, Callable, Dict, Iterable, List, Sequence\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\n\nLinearGAM: Any | None = None\ns: Any | None = None\nte: Any | None = None\n_PYGAM_INITIALISED = False\n\n\ndef _ensure_pygam_loaded() -> None:\n    \"\"\"Attempt to import pyGAM in a crash-safe way.\n\n    Some sandboxed environments ship partial pyGAM builds that segfault during import.\n    We first probe the dependency in a subprocess so the main interpreter survives\n    those failures and can fall back to linear regression.\n    \"\"\"\n    global LinearGAM, s, te, _PYGAM_INITIALISED\n    if _PYGAM_INITIALISED:\n        return\n    _PYGAM_INITIALISED = True\n    try:\n        result = subprocess.run(  # pragma: no cover - defensive subprocess probe\n            [sys.executable, \"-c\", \"import pygam\"],\n            stdout=subprocess.DEVNULL,\n            stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL,\n            check=False,\n            timeout=5,\n        )\n        if result.returncode != 0:\n            return\n        from pygam import LinearGAM as _LinearGAM, s as _s, te as _te\n    except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - pyGAM missing or unsafe\n        return\n    LinearGAM = _LinearGAM\n    s = _s\n    te = _te\n\n\n_ensure_pygam_loaded()\n\n\nNUMERIC_DTYPES = {\n    pl.Float64,\n    pl.Float32,\n    pl.Int64,\n    pl.Int32,\n    pl.Int16,\n    pl.Int8,\n    pl.UInt64,\n    pl.UInt32,\n    pl.UInt16,\n    pl.UInt8,\n}\n\nWEATHER_KEYWORDS = (\"temp\", \"precip\", \"humidity\", \"uv\", \"wind\", \"snow\")\nMARKETING_KEYWORDS = (\"spend\", \"budget\", \"roas\", \"impression\", \"click\", \"promo\")\nMAX_INTERACTIONS = 3\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass BaselineModel:\n    coefficients: Dict[str, float]\n    intercept: float\n    features: List[str]\n    target: str\n    gam: Any | None = None\n\n    def predict(self, frame: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.Series:\n        if self.gam is not None and self.features:\n            missing = [feature for feature in self.features if feature not in frame.columns]\n            if missing:\n                raise KeyError(f\"Missing features required for prediction: {missing}\")\n            X = frame.select(self.features).to_numpy()\n\n            preds = self.gam.predict(X)\n            return pl.Series(name=\"prediction\", values=np.asarray(preds))\n\n        prediction = pl.lit(self.intercept)\n        for feature, coef in self.coefficients.items():\n            if feature in frame.columns:\n                prediction = prediction + pl.col(feature) * coef\n        return frame.select(prediction.alias(\"prediction\")).to_series()\n\n\ndef fit_baseline_model(frame: pl.DataFrame, target: str, features: List[str]) -> BaselineModel:\n    _ensure_pygam_loaded()\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=0.0, features=[], target=target)\n\n    usable_features = [feature for feature in features if feature in frame.columns]\n    if not usable_features:\n        intercept = _safe_mean(frame, target)\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=intercept, features=[], target=target)\n\n    df = frame.select([target] + usable_features).drop_nulls()\n    if df.is_empty():\n        intercept = _safe_mean(frame, target)\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=intercept, features=[], target=target)\n\n    cleaned_features = _filter_features(df, usable_features)\n    if not cleaned_features:\n        intercept = _safe_mean(df, target)\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=intercept, features=[], target=target)\n\n    row_count = df.height\n\n    if LinearGAM and s and te and row_count >= _min_gam_rows(len(cleaned_features)):\n        gam = _fit_gam(df, target, cleaned_features)\n        if gam is not None:\n            return BaselineModel(\n                coefficients={},\n                intercept=float(gam.statistics_[\"intercept\"] if \"intercept\" in gam.statistics_ else gam.coef_[0]),\n                features=cleaned_features,\n                target=target,\n                gam=gam,\n            )\n\n    # Fallback: simple linear regression via numpy lstsq.\n    y = df[target].to_numpy()\n    if not cleaned_features:\n        intercept = float(np.mean(y)) if len(y) else 0.0\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=intercept, features=[], target=target)\n\n    X = np.column_stack([np.ones(len(df))] + [df[col].to_numpy() for col in cleaned_features])\n    coef, *_ = np.linalg.lstsq(X, y, rcond=None)\n    intercept = float(coef[0])\n    coefficients = {feature: float(value) for feature, value in zip(cleaned_features, coef[1:])}\n    return BaselineModel(coefficients=coefficients, intercept=intercept, features=cleaned_features, target=target)\n\n\n\ndef evaluate_r2(model: BaselineModel, frame: pl.DataFrame) -> float:\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return 0.0\n    target = model.target\n    if target not in frame.columns:\n        return 0.0\n    df = frame.select([target] + model.features).drop_nulls() if model.features else frame.select([target]).drop_nulls()\n    if df.is_empty():\n        return 0.0\n    y = df[target].to_numpy()\n    if model.gam is not None and model.features:\n        preds = model.gam.predict(df.select(model.features).to_numpy())\n    else:\n        preds = np.full_like(y, model.intercept, dtype=float)\n        for feature in model.features:\n            preds = preds + model.coefficients.get(feature, 0.0) * df[feature].to_numpy()\n    ss_tot = float(((y - y.mean()) ** 2).sum())\n    ss_res = float(((y - preds) ** 2).sum())\n    return float(1 - ss_res / ss_tot) if ss_tot else 0.0\n\n\ndef _min_gam_rows(feature_count: int) -> int:\n    return max(24, feature_count * 4)\n\n\ndef _filter_features(df: pl.DataFrame, features: Sequence[str]) -> List[str]:\n    cleaned: List[str] = []\n    for feature in features:\n        series = df.get_column(feature)\n        if series.dtype not in NUMERIC_DTYPES:\n            continue\n        if series.null_count() >= df.height:\n            continue\n        if series.n_unique() <= 1:\n            continue\n        cleaned.append(feature)\n    return cleaned\n\n\ndef _fit_gam(df: pl.DataFrame, target: str, features: Sequence[str]) -> LinearGAM | None:\n    if LinearGAM is None or s is None:\n        return None\n    X = df.select(features).to_numpy()\n    y = df[target].to_numpy()\n    if not np.isfinite(X).all() or not np.isfinite(y).all():\n        return None\n\n    row_count = df.height\n    lam_grid = np.logspace(-2, 2, num=4)\n    weights = np.clip(np.abs(y), 1.0, None)\n\n    def _fit_with(\n        builder: Callable[[], LinearGAM],\n        fitter: Callable[[LinearGAM], LinearGAM | None],\n    ) -> LinearGAM | None:\n        try:\n            gam = builder()\n        except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - builder failure\n            return None\n        try:\n            result = fitter(gam)\n        except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - fitting failure\n            return None\n        candidate = result or gam\n        if candidate is None:\n            return None\n        try:\n            # Accessing statistics_ lazily validates the fit without relying on private flags.\n            candidate.statistics_\n        except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - unfitted model\n            return None\n        return candidate\n\n    strategies: List[Callable[[], LinearGAM | None]] = [\n        lambda: _fit_with(\n            lambda: _build_gam(features, row_count),\n            lambda gam: gam.gridsearch(\n                X,\n                y,\n                weights=weights,\n                lam=lam_grid,\n                progress=False,\n            ),\n        ),\n        lambda: _fit_with(\n            lambda: _build_gam(features, row_count),\n            lambda gam: gam.fit(X, y, weights=weights),\n        ),\n        lambda: _fit_with(\n            lambda: LinearGAM(max_iter=200),\n            lambda gam: gam.gridsearch(\n                X,\n                y,\n                weights=weights,\n                lam=lam_grid,\n                progress=False,\n            ),\n        ),\n        lambda: _fit_with(\n            lambda: LinearGAM(max_iter=200),\n            lambda gam: gam.fit(X, y, weights=weights),\n        ),\n    ]\n\n    for attempt in strategies:\n        fitted = attempt()\n        if fitted is not None:\n            return fitted\n    return None\n\n\ndef _build_gam(features: Sequence[str], row_count: int) -> LinearGAM:\n    assert LinearGAM is not None and s is not None  # Guarded by caller.\n    terms = []\n    weather_indices: List[int] = []\n    marketing_indices: List[int] = []\n    for idx, name in enumerate(features):\n        lowered = name.lower()\n        is_weather = _matches_any(lowered, WEATHER_KEYWORDS)\n        is_marketing = _matches_any(lowered, MARKETING_KEYWORDS)\n        splines = _n_splines(row_count, 12 if is_weather else 8)\n        terms.append(s(idx, n_splines=splines, spline_order=3))\n        if is_weather:\n            weather_indices.append(idx)\n        if is_marketing:\n            marketing_indices.append(idx)\n    if te and weather_indices and marketing_indices:\n        for weather_idx, marketing_idx in itertools.islice(\n            itertools.product(weather_indices, marketing_indices),\n            MAX_INTERACTIONS,\n        ):\n            terms.append(te(weather_idx, marketing_idx, n_splines=[5, 5], spline_order=[3, 3]))\n    return LinearGAM(terms=terms, max_iter=200)\n\n\ndef _matches_any(text: str, keywords: Iterable[str]) -> bool:\n    return any(keyword in text for keyword in keywords)\n\n\ndef _n_splines(row_count: int, preferred: int) -> int:\n    upper = max(6, min(preferred, row_count - 1))\n    return max(4, upper)\n\n\ndef _safe_mean(frame: pl.DataFrame, column: str) -> float:\n    if column not in frame.columns or frame[column].null_count() == frame.height:\n        return 0.0\n    return float(frame[column].fill_null(0.0).mean())\n"
}

{
  "path": "apps/worker/flows/experiment_pipeline.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Generate geo holdout experiments and persist results.\"\"\"\n\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom datetime import datetime, timedelta\nfrom typing import Dict\n\nfrom prefect import flow, get_run_logger, task\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom apps.worker.flows.poc_pipeline import TenantContext, fetch_shopify_data\nfrom apps.validation.incrementality import summarise_experiment\nfrom apps.worker.validation.incrementality import (\n    design_experiment_from_orders,\n    summarise_experiment_from_orders,\n    write_experiment_results,\n)\n\n\n@task(name=\"Load incrementality design\")\ndef load_design(shopify_payload: Dict[str, object], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    return design_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, context)\n\n\n@task(name=\"Compute experiment summary\")\ndef compute_summary(assigned: Dict[str, object], observations: pl.DataFrame) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    estimate = summarise_experiment(observations, value_column=\"revenue\")\n    return {\n        \"lift\": estimate.lift,\n        \"absolute_lift\": estimate.absolute_lift,\n        \"p_value\": estimate.p_value,\n        \"conf_low\": estimate.conf_low,\n        \"conf_high\": estimate.conf_high,\n        \"treatment_mean\": estimate.treatment_mean,\n        \"control_mean\": estimate.control_mean,\n        \"sample_size_treatment\": estimate.sample_size_treatment,\n        \"sample_size_control\": estimate.sample_size_control,\n    }\n\n\n@flow(name=\"weathervane-incrementality\")\nasync def orchestrate_incrementality_flow(tenant_id: str, start_date: datetime | None = None, end_date: datetime | None = None) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    if end_date is None:\n        end_date = datetime.utcnow()\n    if start_date is None:\n        start_date = end_date - timedelta(days=365)\n\n    context = TenantContext(tenant_id=tenant_id, start_date=start_date, end_date=end_date)\n    shopify_payload = await fetch_shopify_data(context)\n    design = design_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, context)\n    payload = {\n        \"design\": design,\n        \"generated_at\": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),\n    }\n    summary = summarise_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, design)\n    if summary is not None:\n        payload[\"summary\"] = summary\n\n    write_experiment_results(tenant_id, payload)\n    logger.info(\"Stored incrementality design for %s\", tenant_id)\n    return {\"design\": design, \"summary\": summary}\n"
}

```json
{
  "path": "apps/validation/incrementality.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Geo holdout experiment helpers for proving weather impact.\"\"\"\n\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nimport random\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass, asdict\nfrom math import sqrt\nfrom statistics import NormalDist\nfrom typing import Iterable\n\nimport polars as pl\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass GeoHoldoutConfig:\n    holdout_ratio: float = 0.2\n    min_holdout_units: int = 4\n    seed: int | None = None\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass HoldoutAssignment:\n    geo: str\n    group: str  # \"treatment\" or \"control\"\n    weight: float\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass ExperimentEstimate:\n    treatment_mean: float\n    control_mean: float\n    lift: float\n    absolute_lift: float\n    t_stat: float\n    p_value: float\n    conf_low: float\n    conf_high: float\n    sample_size_treatment: int\n    sample_size_control: int\n\n    @property\n    def is_significant(self) -> bool:\n        return self.p_value < 0.05\n\n\ndef assign_geo_holdout(\n    metrics: pl.DataFrame,\n    config: GeoHoldoutConfig,\n) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    \"\"\"Assign each geo to treatment/control using weighted random sampling.\n\n    Parameters\n    ----------\n    metrics:\n        DataFrame with at least columns ``geo`` and ``weight`` (e.g., revenue share).\n    config:\n        Assignment parameters.\n    \"\"\"\n\n    if \"geo\" not in metrics.columns:\n        raise ValueError(\"metrics DataFrame must contain a 'geo' column\")\n\n    assign_df = metrics.with_columns([\n        pl.col(\"weight\").fill_null(1.0).alias(\"weight\"),\n    ])\n    weights = assign_df.get_column(\"weight\").to_list()\n    if not weights:\n        raise ValueError(\"metrics DataFrame must contain at least one geo record\")\n\n    rng = random.Random(config.seed)\n\n    holdout_count = max(int(round(len(weights) * config.holdout_ratio)), config.min_holdout_units)\n    holdout_count = min(holdout_count, len(weights))  # guard for small datasets\n\n    holdout_indices = _weighted_sample_without_replacement(weights, holdout_count, rng)\n\n    groups = [\"control\" if idx in holdout_indices else \"treatment\" for idx in range(len(weights))]\n\n    return assign_df.with_columns(pl.Series(\"group\", groups))\n\n\ndef _weighted_sample_without_replacement(weights: list[float], k: int, rng: random.Random) -> list[int]:\n    if k <= 0:\n        return []\n    available = list(range(len(weights)))\n    selected: list[int] = []\n    for _ in range(min(k, len(available))):\n        total = sum(weights[idx] for idx in available if weights[idx] > 0)\n        if total <= 0:\n            break\n        threshold = rng.random() * total\n        cumulative = 0.0\n        for idx in list(available):\n            w = weights[idx]\n            if w <= 0:\n                continue\n            cumulative += w\n            if cumulative >= threshold:\n                selected.append(idx)\n                available.remove(idx)\n                break\n    return selected\n\n\ndef geo_revenue_metrics(orders: pl.DataFrame) -> tuple[pl.DataFrame, str | None]:\n    \"\"\"Summarise order revenue per geo for experiment design.\"\"\"\n\n    if orders.is_empty():\n        return pl.DataFrame(), None\n\n    geo_column = None\n    for column in (\"ship_geohash\", \"ship_region\", \"ship_city\"):\n        if column in orders.columns:\n            geo_column = column\n            break\n    if geo_column is None:\n        return pl.DataFrame(), None\n\n    frame = orders.drop_nulls(subset=[geo_column, \"net_revenue\"])\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return pl.DataFrame(), geo_column\n\n    summary = (\n        frame.group_by(geo_column)\n        .agg(pl.col(\"net_revenue\").sum().alias(\"revenue\"))\n        .filter(pl.col(\"revenue\") > 0)\n        .rename({geo_column: \"geo\"})\n        .with_columns(pl.col(\"geo\").cast(pl.Utf8))\n        .sort(\"revenue\", descending=True)\n    )\n    if summary.is_empty():\n        return summary, geo_column\n\n    total = float(summary.get_column(\"revenue\").sum())\n    if total <= 0:\n        return pl.DataFrame(), geo_column\n\n    return summary.with_columns((pl.col(\"revenue\") / total).alias(\"weight\")), geo_column\n\n\ndef design_holdout_from_orders(\n    orders: pl.DataFrame,\n    config: GeoHoldoutConfig,\n) -> dict[str, object]:\n    \"\"\"Return a geo holdout design recommendation.\"\"\"\n\n    metrics, geo_column = geo_revenue_metrics(orders)\n    geo_count = int(metrics.height)\n    if geo_count < max(config.min_holdout_units * 2, 4):\n        return {\n            \"status\": \"insufficient_geo\",\n            \"geo_count\": geo_count,\n            \"holdout_ratio\": config.holdout_ratio,\n        }\n\n    assigned = assign_geo_holdout(metrics, config)\n    control_mask = pl.col(\"group\") == \"control\"\n    control_share = float(assigned.filter(control_mask).get_column(\"weight\").sum())\n    holdout_count = int(assigned.filter(control_mask).height)\n\n    return {\n        \"status\": \"ready\",\n        \"geo_count\": geo_count,\n        \"holdout_count\": holdout_count,\n        \"control_share\": control_share,\n        \"holdout_ratio\": config.holdout_ratio,\n        \"geo_column\": geo_column,\n        \"assignment\": assigned.select([\"geo\", \"group\", \"weight\"]).to_dicts(),\n    }\n\n\ndef summarise_experiment(\n    observations: pl.DataFrame,\n    value_column: str,\n    group_column: str = \"group\",\n    treatment_value: str = \"treatment\",\n    control_value: str = \"control\",\n) -> ExperimentEstimate:\n    \"\"\"Compute lift statistics between treatment and control groups.\"\"\"\n\n    if group_column not in observations.columns:\n        raise ValueError(f\"observations missing group column '{group_column}'\")\n    if value_column not in observations.columns:\n        raise ValueError(f\"observations missing value column '{value_column}'\")\n\n    treatment = [float(value) for value in observations.filter(pl.col(group_column) == treatment_value).get_column(value_column).to_list()]\n    control = [float(value) for value in observations.filter(pl.col(group_column) == control_value).get_column(value_column).to_list()]\n\n    if len(treatment) < 2 or len(control) < 2:\n        raise ValueError(\"Treatment and control require at least two observations each\")\n\n    treatment_mean = _mean(treatment)\n    control_mean = _mean(control)\n    absolute_lift = treatment_mean - control_mean\n    lift = absolute_lift / control_mean if control_mean else 0.0\n\n    treatment_var = _sample_variance(treatment)\n    control_var = _sample_variance(control)\n\n    se = sqrt(treatment_var / len(treatment) + control_var / len(control))\n    if se > 0:\n        t_stat = absolute_lift / se\n        p_value = 2 * (1 - NormalDist().cdf(abs(t_stat)))\n    else:\n        t_stat = 0.0\n        p_value = 1.0\n\n    z_critical = 1.96\n    conf_low = absolute_lift - z_critical * se\n    conf_high = absolute_lift + z_critical * se\n\n    return ExperimentEstimate(\n        treatment_mean=treatment_mean,\n        control_mean=control_mean,\n        lift=lift,\n        absolute_lift=absolute_lift,\n        t_stat=float(t_stat),\n        p_value=float(p_value),\n        conf_low=conf_low,\n        conf_high=conf_high,\n        sample_size_treatment=len(treatment),\n        sample_size_control=len(control),\n    )\n\n\ndef compute_holdout_summary(\n    orders: pl.DataFrame,\n    assignment: Iterable[dict[str, object]],\n    *,\n    geo_column: str,\n    value_column: str = \"net_revenue\",\n) -> ExperimentEstimate:\n    \"\"\"Aggregate order outcomes by geo and compute lift between treatment/control.\"\"\"\n\n    assignment = [entry for entry in assignment if entry.get(\"geo\") and entry.get(\"group\")]\n    if not assignment:\n        raise ValueError(\"Assignment data required to compute holdout summary\")\n    if geo_column not in orders.columns:\n        raise ValueError(f\"orders missing geo column '{geo_column}'\")\n    if value_column not in orders.columns:\n        raise ValueError(f\"orders missing value column '{value_column}'\")\n\n    mapping = {str(entry[\"geo\"]): str(entry[\"group\"]) for entry in assignment}\n    frame = (\n        orders.drop_nulls(subset=[geo_column, value_column])\n        .group_by(geo_column)\n        .agg(pl.col(value_column).sum().alias(value_column))\n        .with_columns(pl.col(geo_column).cast(pl.Utf8))\n        .with_columns(pl.col(geo_column).replace(mapping).alias(\"group\"))\n        .drop_nulls(subset=[\"group\"])\n    )\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        raise ValueError(\"No matching observations for experiment assignment\")\n\n    return summarise_experiment(frame, value_column=value_column)\n\n\ndef estimate_to_payload(estimate: ExperimentEstimate) -> dict[str, object]:\n    \"\"\"Serialize experiment estimate for persistence.\"\"\"\n\n    payload = asdict(estimate)\n    payload[\"is_significant\"] = estimate.is_significant\n    return payload\n\n\ndef _mean(values: Iterable[float]) -> float:\n    values = list(values)\n    if not values:\n        raise ValueError(\"Cannot compute mean of empty sequence\")\n    return sum(values) / len(values)\n\n\ndef _sample_variance(values: Iterable[float]) -> float:\n    values = list(values)\n    if len(values) < 2:\n        raise ValueError(\"At least two observations required for variance\")\n    mean_value = _mean(values)\n    return sum((value - mean_value) ** 2 for value in values) / (len(values) - 1)\n\n\ndef aggregate_metric(\n    frame: pl.DataFrame,\n    value_column: str,\n    group_columns: Iterable[str],\n    agg: str = \"mean\",\n) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    \"\"\"Aggregate metric per group before summarising.\n\n    Example:\n        aggregate_metric(df, value_column=\\\"revenue\\\", group_columns=[\\\"geo\\\", \\\"group\\\"], agg=\\\"sum\\\")\n    \"\"\"\n\n    if value_column not in frame.columns:\n        raise ValueError(f\"value column '{value_column}' not present\")\n\n    aggregations = {\n        \"mean\": pl.col(value_column).mean().alias(value_column),\n        \"sum\": pl.col(value_column).sum().alias(value_column),\n        \"median\": pl.col(value_column).median().alias(value_column),\n    }\n    if agg not in aggregations:\n        raise ValueError(f\"Unsupported aggregation '{agg}'. Valid options: {list(aggregations)}\")\n\n    return frame.group_by(group_columns).agg(aggregations[agg])\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

{
  "path": "apps/worker/validation/incrementality.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Persist incrementality experiment designs and observations.\"\"\"\n\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Dict, Optional, Sequence\n\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom apps.validation.incrementality import (\n    GeoHoldoutConfig,\n    compute_holdout_summary,\n    design_holdout_from_orders,\n    estimate_to_payload,\n    aggregate_metric,\n    summarise_experiment,\n)\nfrom shared.libs.storage.state import JsonStateStore\n\nSTORE = JsonStateStore(root=Path(\"storage/metadata/incrementality\"))\n\n\ndef design_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload: Dict[str, object], context) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    orders_path = (shopify_payload or {}).get(\"orders_path\")\n    if not orders_path:\n        return {\"status\": \"missing_orders\"}\n    path = Path(orders_path)\n    if not path.exists():\n        return {\"status\": \"missing_orders\"}\n    orders = pl.read_parquet(path)\n    config = GeoHoldoutConfig(\n        holdout_ratio=0.25,\n        min_holdout_units=4,\n        seed=int(context.end_date.strftime(\"%Y%m%d\")),\n    )\n    design = design_holdout_from_orders(orders, config)\n    design[\"tenant_id\"] = context.tenant_id\n    design[\"lookback_days\"] = (context.end_date - context.start_date).days\n    design[\"generated_at\"] = datetime.utcnow().isoformat()\n    return design\n\n\ndef write_experiment_results(tenant_id: str, payload: Dict[str, object]) -> None:\n    existing = STORE.load(\"designs\", tenant_id)\n    merged = {**existing, **payload}\n    STORE.save(\"designs\", tenant_id, merged)\n\n\ndef load_experiment_results(tenant_id: str) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    return STORE.load(\"designs\", tenant_id)\n\n\ndef summarise_experiment_from_orders(\n    shopify_payload: Dict[str, object],\n    design: Dict[str, object],\n) -> Optional[Dict[str, object]]:\n    if not design or design.get(\"status\") != \"ready\":\n        return None\n    orders_path = (shopify_payload or {}).get(\"orders_path\")\n    if not orders_path:\n        return None\n    path = Path(orders_path)\n    if not path.exists():\n        return None\n\n    orders = pl.read_parquet(path)\n    assignment = design.get(\"assignment\") or []\n    geo_column = design.get(\"geo_column\")\n    if not geo_column:\n        return None\n\n    try:\n        estimate = compute_holdout_summary(orders, assignment, geo_column=geo_column)\n    except ValueError:\n        return None\n\n    payload = estimate_to_payload(estimate)\n    payload[\"generated_at\"] = datetime.utcnow().isoformat()\n    return payload\n\n\ndef record_experiment_observations(\n    tenant_id: str,\n    observations: Sequence[dict[str, object]] | pl.DataFrame,\n    *,\n    value_column: str = \"revenue\",\n) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    \"\"\"Persist experiment outcomes and update summary for a tenant.\"\"\"\n\n    frame = observations if isinstance(observations, pl.DataFrame) else pl.DataFrame(observations)\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        raise ValueError(\"Experiment observations are empty\")\n    if {\"geo\", \"group\", value_column} - set(frame.columns):\n        missing = {\"geo\", \"group\", value_column} - set(frame.columns)\n        raise ValueError(f\"Observations missing required columns: {sorted(missing)}\")\n\n    aggregated = aggregate_metric(frame, value_column=value_column, group_columns=[\"geo\", \"group\"], agg=\"sum\")\n    estimate = summarise_experiment(aggregated, value_column=value_column)\n\n    summary = estimate_to_payload(estimate)\n    summary_generated_at = datetime.utcnow().isoformat()\n    summary[\"generated_at\"] = summary_generated_at\n\n    aggregated_records = aggregated.to_dicts()\n\n    write_experiment_results(\n        tenant_id,\n        {\n            \"summary\": summary,\n            \"aggregated_observations\": aggregated_records,\n        },\n    )\n\n    return {\n        \"summary\": summary,\n        \"aggregated_observations\": aggregated_records,\n    }\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

timedelta\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Iterable\n\nimport geohash2  # type: ignore\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom shared.libs.storage.lake import LakeWriter\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass WeatherShock:\n    start_day: int\n    end_day: int\n    temp_delta: float = 0.0\n    rain_mm: float = 0.0\n\n    def applies(self, day_index: int) -> bool:\n        return self.start_day <= day_index <= self.end_day\n\n\nDEFAULT_GEOS = [(37.7749, -122.4194), (40.7128, -74.0060)]\n\n\ndef seed_synthetic_tenant(\n    lake_root: Path | str,\n    tenant_id: str,\n    days: int = 7,\n    geos: Iterable[tuple[float, float]] | None = None,\n    shocks: Iterable[WeatherShock] | None = None,\n) -> None:\n    geos = list(geos or DEFAULT_GEOS)\n    shocks = list(shocks or [])\n\n    writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n    today = datetime(2024, 1, 7)\n\n    orders_rows = []\n    ads_meta_rows = []\n    ads_google_rows = []\n    promos_rows = []\n    weather_rows = []\n\n    for i in range(days):\n        day = today - timedelta(days=i)\n        date_str = day.strftime(\"%Y-%m-%d\")\n\n        temp_bonus = 0.0\n        rain_bonus = 0.0\n        multiplier = 1.0\n        for shock in shocks:\n            if shock.applies(i):\n                temp_bonus += shock.temp_delta\n                rain_bonus += shock.rain_mm\n                multiplier += shock.temp_delta * 0.02\n\n        orders_rows.append({\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"created_at\": f\"{date_str}T00:00:00Z\",\n            \"net_revenue\": float(120 + i * 4 + temp_bonus * 3),\n            \"ship_latitude\": geos[0][0],\n            \"ship_longitude\": geos[0][1],\n            \"ship_geohash\": geohash2.encode(geos[0][0], geos[0][1], 5),\n        })\n\n        ads_meta_rows.append({\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"date\": date_str,\n            \"channel\": \"meta\",\n            \"spend\": float((25 + i) * multiplier),\n            \"conversions\": float(2 + i * 0.1),\n        })\n\n        ads_google_rows.append({\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"date\": date_str,\n            \"channel\": \"google\",\n            \"spend\": float(18 + i * 0.6),\n            \"conversions\": float(1.2 + i * 0.07 * multiplier),\n        })\n\n        promos_rows.append({\n            \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n            \"send_date\": f\"{date_str}T12:00:00Z\",\n            \"campaign_id\": f\"promo-{i}\",\n            \"discount_pct\": float(10 if i % 3 == 0 else 0),\n        })\n\n        for lat, lon in geos:\n            gh = geohash2.encode(lat, lon, 5)\n            base_temp = 18 + i + lat * 0.05\n            base_precip = (i % 2) * 2\n            weather_rows.append({\n                \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n                \"date\": date_str,\n                \"geohash\": gh,\n                \"temp_c\": float(base_temp + temp_bonus),\n                \"precip_mm\": float(base_precip + rain_bonus),\n            })\n\n    weather_df = pl.DataFrame(weather_rows)\n    if not weather_df.is_empty():\n        weather_df = weather_df.with_columns([\n            (pl.col(\"temp_c\") - pl.col(\"temp_c\").mean().over(\"geohash\")).alias(\"temp_anomaly\"),\n            (pl.col(\"precip_mm\") - pl.col(\"precip_mm\").mean().over(\"geohash\")).alias(\"precip_anomaly\"),\n            pl.col(\"temp_c\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=1)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"temp_roll7\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_mm\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=1)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"precip_roll7\"),\n        ])\n        weather_rows = weather_df.to_dicts()\n\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_shopify_orders\", orders_rows)\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_meta_ads\", ads_meta_rows)\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_google_ads\", ads_google_rows)\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_promos\", promos_rows)\n    writer.write_records(f\"{tenant_id}_weather_daily\", weather_rows)\n"
}

parser.add_argument(\n        \"--lake-root\",\n        default=\"storage/lake/raw\",\n        help=\"Lake root directory for retention sweeps\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n \"--performance-root\",\n        dest=\"performance_root\",\n        default=\"storage/metadata/performance\",\n        help=\"Directory containing stored performance records\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--alert-forecast\",\n        action=\"store_true\",\n        help=\"Run forecast coverage alert, emitting warning when horizons fall below threshold\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--alert-threshold\",\n        type=float,\n        default=0.8,\n        help=\"Coverage threshold used for alerts (default: 0.8)\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n   )\n    return parser.parse_args(list(argv) if argv is not None else None)\n\n\ndef _parse_datetime(value: str | None) -> datetime | None:\n    if not value:\n        return None\n    return path.open(\"a\") as fh:\n        fh.write(json.dumps(entry, sort_keys=True) + \"\\n\")\n\n\ndef _run_retention(args: argparse.Namespace) -> dict[str, object]:\n    tenant_id = None if args.all_tenants or args.tenant.upper() == \"ALL\" else args.tenant\n    return run_retention_sweep(\n        tenant_id=tenant_id,\n        retention_days=args.retention_days,\n        lake_root=args.lake_root,\n args.all_tenants or args.tenant.upper() == \"ALL\":\n        raise SystemExit(\"Pipeline requires a specific tenant; use --retention-only for bulk retention\")\n\n    pipeline_result = retention_result = _run_retention(args)\n        print(\"[weathervane-worker] Retention sweep complete\")\n        if retention_result:\n            print(retention_result)\n\n\nif __name__ == timedelta\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Any, Dict, Iterable, List, Tuple\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\nfrom loguru import logger\n\nfrom apps.model.baseline import BaselineModel, LinearGAM, evaluate_r2, fit_baseline_model\nfrom shared.feature_store.feature_builder import (\n    FeatureBuilder,\n    FeatureLeakageError,\n    FeatureMatrix,\n    TARGET_COLUMN,\n)\n\nNUMERIC_DTYPES = {\n    pl.Float64,\n    pl.Float32,\n    pl.Int64,\n    pl.Int32,\n    pl.Int16,\n    pl.Int8,\n    pl.UInt64,\n    pl.UInt32,\n    pl.UInt16,\n    pl.UInt8,\n}\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass BaselineTrainingResult:\n    tenant_id: str\n    run_id: str\n    model: BaselineModel\n    model_path: Path\n    metadata_path: Path\n    metadata: Dict[str, Any]\n\n\ndef train_baseline(\n    tenant_id: str,\n    start: datetime,\n    end: datetime,\n    *,\n    lake_root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/lake/raw\"),\n    output_root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/models/baseline\"),\n    run_id: str | None = None,\n    feature_min_rows: int = 14,\n) -> BaselineTrainingResult:\n    \"\"\"Train and persist the weather-aware baseline model for a tenant.\"\"\"\n\n    builder = FeatureBuilder(lake_root=lake_root, feature_min_rows=feature_min_rows)\n    leakage_info: Dict[str, Any] = {\n        \"status\": \"clean\",\n        \"removed_rows\": 0,\n        \"forward_leakage_rows\": 0,\n        \"forecast_leakage_rows\": 0,\n        \"leakage_dates\": [],\n        \"forward_leakage_dates\": [],\n        \"forecast_leakage_dates\": [],\n    }\n\n    try:\n        matrix = builder.build(tenant_id, start, end)\n    except FeatureLeakageError as exc:\n        if exc.matrix is None:\n            raise\n        matrix = exc.matrix\n        leakage_info.update(\n            {\n                \"status\": \"sanitized\",\n                \"message\": str(exc),\n                \"removed_rows\": exc.leakage_rows,\n                \"forward_leakage_rows\": exc.forward_rows,\n                \"forecast_leakage_rows\": exc.forecast_rows,\n                \"leakage_dates\": exc.leakage_dates,\n                \"forward_leakage_dates\": exc.forward_dates,\n                \"forecast_leakage_dates\": exc.forecast_dates,\n            }\n        )\n\n    observed = _prepare_observed_frame(matrix)\n    if observed.is_empty():\n        raise ValueError(f\"No observed targets available for tenant={tenant_id}\")\n\n    features = _candidate_features(observed)\n\n    train_frame, holdout_frame = _split_train_holdout(observed)\n    model = fit_baseline_model(train_frame, target=TARGET_COLUMN, features=features)\n\n    train_metrics = _compute_metrics(model, train_frame, TARGET_COLUMN)\n    holdout_metrics = _compute_metrics(model, holdout_frame, TARGET_COLUMN)\n    influences = _rank_features(model, train_frame)\n\n    gam_min_rows = max(24, len(model.features) * 4) if model.features else 24\n    if model.gam is None:\n        if not model.features:\n            gam_reason = \"no_features\"\n        elif len(train_frame) + len(holdout_frame) < gam_min_rows:\n            gam_reason = \"insufficient_rows\"\n        elif LinearGAM is None:\n            gam_reason = \"pygam_unavailable\"\n        else:\n            gam_reason = \"fallback_linear\"\n    else:\n        gam_reason = \"gam\"\n\n    timestamp = datetime.utcnow().replace(microsecond=0).isoformat() + \"Z\"\n    resolved_run_id = run_id or datetime.utcnow().strftime(\"%Y%m%dT%H%M%SZ\")\n    output_dir = Path(output_root) / tenant_id / resolved_run_id\n    output_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n\n    model_path = output_dir / \"baseline_model.pkl\"\n    with model_path.open(\"wb\") as fh:\n        pickle.dump(model, fh)\n\n    diagnostics_path = None\n    if not holdout_frame.is_empty():\n        diagnostics = holdout_frame.with_columns(\n            model.predict(holdout_frame).alias(\"prediction\")\n        )\n        diagnostics_path = output_dir / \"holdout_diagnostics.parquet\"\n        diagnostics.write_parquet(diagnostics_path, compression=\"zstd\")\n\n    metadata = {\n        \"tenant_id\": tenant_id,\n        \"run_id\": resolved_run_id,\n        \"timestamp_utc\": timestamp,\n        \"window\": {\"start\": start.isoformat(), \"end\": end.isoformat()},\n        \"data\": {\n            \"observed_rows\": int(observed.height),\n            \"train_rows\": int(train_frame.height),\n            \"holdout_rows\": int(holdout_frame.height),\n            \"feature_columns\": len(features),\n            \"orders_rows\": matrix.orders_rows,\n            \"ads_rows\": matrix.ads_rows,\n            \"promo_rows\": matrix.promo_rows,\n            \"weather_rows\": matrix.weather_rows,\n            \"latest_observed_target_date\": matrix.latest_observed_date,\n        },\n        \"features\": list(model.features),\n        \"top_features\": influences,\n        \"gam\": {\n            \"used\": model.gam is not None,\n            \"reason\": gam_reason,\n            \"min_required_rows\": gam_min_rows,\n        },\n        \"training\": train_metrics,\n        \"holdout\": holdout_metrics,\n        \"leakage_guardrail\": {\n            **leakage_info,\n            \"leakage_risk_rows\": matrix.leakage_risk_rows,\n            \"forward_leakage_rows_matrix\": matrix.forward_leakage_rows,\n            \"forecast_leakage_rows_matrix\": matrix.forecast_leakage_rows,\n        },\n        \"artifacts\": {\n            \"model_path\": str(model_path),\n            \"holdout_diagnostics\": str(diagnostics_path) if diagnostics_path else None,\n        },\n    }\n\n    metadata_path = output_dir / \"metadata.json\"\n    metadata_path.write_text(json.dumps(metadata, indent=2, sort_keys=True))\n\n    logger.info(\n        \"Baseline training complete for tenant=%s run=%s | rows=%d gam=%s r2=%.3f holdout_r2=%.3f\",\n        tenant_id,\n        resolved_run_id,\n        metadata[\"data\"][\"observed_rows\"],\n        metadata[\"gam\"][\"reason\"],\n        metadata[\"training\"][\"r2\"],\n        metadata[\"holdout\"][\"r2\"],\n    )\n\n    return BaselineTrainingResult(\n        tenant_id=tenant_id,\n        run_id=resolved_run_id,\n        model=model,\n        model_path=model_path,\n        metadata_path=metadata_path,\n        metadata=metadata,\n    )\n\n\ndef _prepare_observed_frame(matrix: FeatureMatrix) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    observed = matrix.observed_frame\n    drop_cols = [col for col in (\"target_available\", \"leakage_risk\", \"tenant_id\") if col in observed.columns]\n    if drop_cols:\n        observed = observed.drop(drop_cols)\n    return observed.sort(\"date\")\n\n\ndef _candidate_features(frame: pl.DataFrame) -> List[str]:\n    return [\n        column\n        for column, dtype in frame.schema.items()\n        if column != TARGET_COLUMN and dtype in NUMERIC_DTYPES\n    ]\n\n\ndef _split_train_holdout(frame: pl.DataFrame, holdout_min: int = 14, frac: float = 0.2) -> Tuple[pl.DataFrame, pl.DataFrame]:\n    total = frame.height\n    if total <= 2:\n        return frame, frame.clear()\n    holdout = max(int(total * frac), holdout_min if total > holdout_min else 1)\n    if holdout >= total:\n        holdout = max(1, total // 3)\n    train_rows = max(total - holdout, 1)\n    if train_rows == total:\n        return frame, frame.clear()\n    train_frame = frame.head(train_rows)\n    holdout_frame = frame.tail(total - train_rows)\n    return train_frame, holdout_frame\n\n\ndef _compute_metrics(model: BaselineModel, frame: pl.DataFrame, target: str) -> Dict[str, float]:\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return {\n            \"rows\": 0,\n            \"r2\": 0.0,\n            \"mae\": 0.0,\n            \"rmse\": 0.0,\n            \"bias\": 0.0,\n            \"mean_prediction\": 0.0,\n            \"std_prediction\": 0.0,\n        }\n    preds = model.predict(frame).to_numpy()\n    actuals = frame[target].to_numpy()\n    residuals = actuals - preds\n    mae = float(np.mean(np.abs(residuals)))\n    rmse = float(np.sqrt(np.mean(residuals ** 2)))\n    bias = float(np.mean(residuals))\n    mean_prediction = float(np.mean(preds))\n    std_prediction = float(np.std(preds))\n    r2 = evaluate_r2(model, frame)\n    rows = len(actuals)\n    return {\n        \"rows\": int(rows),\n        \"r2\": _clean_float(r2),\n        \"mae\": _clean_float(mae),\n        \"rmse\": _clean_float(rmse),\n        \"bias\": _clean_float(bias),\n        \"mean_prediction\": _clean_float(mean_prediction),\n        \"std_prediction\": _clean_float(std_prediction),\n    }\n\n\ndef _rank_features(model: BaselineModel, frame: pl.DataFrame, limit: int = 8) -> List[Dict[str, float]]:\n    if frame.is_empty() or not model.features:\n        return []\n\n    rankings: List[Tuple[str, float]] = []\n    if model.gam is None and model.coefficients:\n        for feature in model.features:\n            if feature not in model.coefficients or feature not in frame.columns:\n                continue\n            values = frame[feature].to_numpy()\n            if values.size == 0:\n                continue\n            std = float(np.std(values))\n            if not math.isfinite(std) or std == 0.0:\n                continue\n            influence = abs(model.coefficients[feature]) * std\n            rankings.append((feature, influence))\n    else:\n        preds = model.predict(frame).to_numpy()\n        for feature in model.features:\n            if feature not in frame.columns:\n                continue\n            values = frame[feature].to_numpy()\n            if values.size == 0:\n                continue\n            if np.allclose(values, values[0]):\n                continue\n            corr = np.corrcoef(values, preds)[0, 1]\n            if not np.isfinite(corr):\n                continue\n            rankings.append((feature, float(abs(corr))))\n\n    rankings.sort(key=lambda item: item[1], reverse=True)\n    top = rankings[:limit]\n    return [{\"feature\": name, \"influence\": _clean_float(score)} for name, score in top]\n\n\ndef _clean_float(value: float) -> float:\n    if isinstance(value, (int, float)) and math.isfinite(value):\n        return float(value)\n    return 0.0\n\n\ndef _parse_args(argv: Iterable[str] | None = None) -> argparse.Namespace:\n    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description=\"Train WeatherVane baseline (GAM) model\")\n    parser.add_argument(\"tenant\", help=\"Tenant identifier to train\")\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--start\",\n        type=_parse_date,\n        help=\"Start date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to end - lookback-days.\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--end\",\n        type=_parse_date,\n        help=\"End date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to today (UTC).\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--lookback-days\",\n        type=int,\n        default=365,\n        help=\"Window length when --start is omitted.\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--lake-root\",\n        default=os.getenv(\"STORAGE_LAKE_ROOT\", \"storage/lake/raw\"),\n        help=\"Root directory for raw lake datasets.\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--output-root\",\n        default=os.getenv(\"BASELINE_OUTPUT_ROOT\", \"storage/models/baseline\"),\n        help=\"Directory to store trained model artifacts.\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--run-id\",\n        help=\"Optional run identifier (defaults to timestamp).\",\n    )\n    parser.add_argument(\n        \"--feature-min-rows\",\n        type=int,\n        default=14,\n        help=\"Minimum rows required before generating lag/rolling features.\",\n    )\n    return parser.parse_args(list(argv) if argv is not None else None)\n\n\ndef _parse_date(value: str) -> datetime:\n    return datetime.strptime(value, \"%Y-%m-%d\")\n\n\ndef train(argv: Iterable[str] | None = None) -> BaselineTrainingResult:\n    args = _parse_args(argv)\n    end = args.end or datetime.utcnow()\n    start = args.start or (end - timedelta(days=int(args.lookback_days)))\n    return train_baseline(\n        tenant_id=args.tenant,\n        start=start,\n        end=end,\n        lake_root=args.lake_root,\n        output_root=args.output_root,\n        run_id=args.run_id,\n        feature_min_rows=int(args.feature_min_rows),\n    )\n\n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    train()\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

I'm mapping out a complete uplift modeling module including config, training, metrics, reporting, and testing. The goal is to create `apps/model/uplift.py` with dataclasses, training using random forests or fallback regressors, thorough metric calculations (like RMSE, top decile lift, Qini AUC), and JSON report generation. I'll also plan synthetic dataset tests ensuring positive uplift metrics and artifact creation per the requirements. This will help the user build a robust causal uplift modeling solution integrated into the repo structure.
